posts.post_content:
You would not split the damage taken from creatures in combat. The combined damage done by all creatures resolves as a single object on the stack (310.1; 310.4).   
  
If you have two EA's in play you would only choose one of them for each instance of damage occurring, and you get to decide which one (419.1a; 419.6c; 419.9a).  
  
Deathtouch most certainly would kill the angel, since this redirection effect doesn't change the source of the damage.
posts.html:
You would not split the damage taken from creatures in combat. The combined damage done by all creatures resolves as a single object on the stack (310.1; 310.4).

If you have two EA's in play you would only choose one of them for each instance of damage occurring, and you get to decide which one (419.1a; 419.6c; 419.9a).

Deathtouch most certainly would kill the angel, since this redirection effect doesn't change the source of the damage.

posts.post_content:
? ? ? ? Why is everyone discussing how damage is dealt when all of you should be talking about the positive and negative aspects of the card? If your unsure of how the EA's ability then look in a rule book or consult a rule-guru! Almost every previous comment here is wasted on senseless talk about the way the mechanic works.
  
   
As for what I think of the card, here's what I have to say: epic yet expensive. At such a high a cost EA is restricted to control (and possibly combo) decks only. Although combo and control decks usually will have an entire board set up by turn eight, ensuring that the EA is utilized to its full potential. What I mean by this is that, by the time EA is casted, you don't want it as the only card that you have in play. In such a case your archangel would be subject to lethal damage from the opponents creatures and spells, so rather it would be logical to have several enchantments and creature in play first. Of course, I would imagine that most players wou... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Infect gives her -1/-1, and no poison counters to you, deathtouch will also kill her (if it has any power, most deathtouchers do) for the same reason.  
  
Her ability says "instead" which is a replacement effect, its like saying, if you would tap a land for mana, you get double instead, you never add one mana to your pool, you add two. She is the same way, if you would get hurt, she does instead, you never get hit, she does (unless she dies).  
  
Deathtouch states, any damage dealt by this creature is lethal, the creature is inflicting damage to Archangel, so she dies.  
  
Infect says, deals it to players as poison counters and to creatures as -1/-1 counters. The damage never hits you, it just hits her, which gives her -1/-1 counters. The effect is static, its not like you can stack on it, and get it to change targets (you can't almost take infect poison and redirect it to a creature, and have that creature take poison counters, it will be -1/-1 counters)
posts.html:
Infect gives her -1/-1, and no poison counters to you, deathtouch will also kill her (if it has any power, most deathtouchers do) for the same reason.

Her ability says "instead" which is a replacement effect, its like saying, if you would tap a land for mana, you get double instead, you never add one mana to your pool, you add two. She is the same way, if you would get hurt, she does instead, you never get hit, she does (unless she dies).

Deathtouch states, any damage dealt by this creature is lethal, the creature is inflicting damage to Archangel, so she dies.

Infect says, deals it to players as poison counters and to creatures as -1/-1 counters. The damage never hits you, it just hits her, which gives her -1/-1 counters. The effect is static, its not like you can stack on it, and get it to change targets (you can't almost take infect poison and redirect it to a creature, and have that creature take poison counters, it will be -1/-1 counters)

Posted By: SgtSwaggr (8/14/2011 3:58:49 PM)

posts.post_content: Errr... I'm pretty sure Deathtouch doesn't kill it if it takes the damage after it has been shelled out and dealt to the player first (since the state is checked before the damage is assigned to the player. Empyrial Archangel is not blocking the creature, and deathtouch has no effect the player, so the damage is assigned normally to the Archangel in the same way that it would take Infect damage as normal damage because it would become poison counters on a player, but it's state is as damage against a player, rather than -1/-1 counters on the Archangel. The source hasn't changed, but the damage is all funneled in together as ususal before being deat to the player, and then assigned to Empyreal Archangel, meaning that the state-check has already occured.
posts.html:

I have never really been a fan, I'm sure that this can be used in combos, but I just don't really think it's that great, especially for the multicolored cost, though it can be used in a pinch. If it had flash and split second, though, that would make me like it more.
